Package controller

Class ModifyProductController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.ModifyProductController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class ModifyProductController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    This class is used to modify values of an existing product, associate and disassociated parts to a product from inventory.

      • searchParts

        public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> searchParts​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
                                                    throws java.io.IOException
        This method searches by part ID or part name from the parts table.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - - This event handler searches the parts either by ID or name from the parts table.
        Returns:
        - This returns the search results for a part ID or part Name
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - This IO Exception is thrown if an error occurs.

        This method adds a part from the parts table and associates it with the products table.
        Parameters:
        event - - This event handler adds a part to the associated parts table.

      • removeAssociatedPart

      • isPriceNumeric

        public boolean isPriceNumeric​(java.lang.String strNum)
        Method checks to see if price text field value entered is a numeric value only.
        Parameters:
        strNum - - This String is used to verify the price is a double and not a string for validation purposes.
        Returns:
        - This returns true if it is a double and returns false if it is a string.

      • tryIntegerValue

        public boolean tryIntegerValue​(java.lang.String strNum)
        This method checks if the integer values for inventory, min, and max text fields are integers and not doubles or floats
        Parameters:
        strNum - - This is used to verify that an integer value is entered and not a double or floating point for validation purposes.
        Returns:
        - This returns true if it is an integer and false if it is a double or a floating point.
